subject: Farewell to Finland
event:
We're back in Helsinki for one last night.  Tomorrow at the crack of dawn (which cracks very very early here in Finland) we're off again.  Parris returns to Ireland, and I head home to the cats, the green chile, and A DANCE WITH DRAGONS.  We'll meet again in Montreal.  Ah, the jet set life...

Estonia was great, and Turku was fun as well.  I hope to write more about all these places once I'm home.

Thanks for all my Finnish friends, new and old, for making this is awonderful trip.  Finncon rocks.

comments.article: Dance with Dragons, yeah!  You coming home safe, yay!!
comments.subject: Dance

comments.article: Happy and safe travel, George!
Turku is a place?  I just thought it was a band.  Wikipedia here I come.
You have more moves than a can of worms.  Hope you had a good time and have a safe journey home.

Thank you for coming - it certainly was wonderful to meet you in Finncon and to have dinner with you and Parris yesterday! I hope you had a good time on your mini-tour of Turku.

I'm looking forward to perhaps meeting you again in a Worldcon somewhere - probably not in Finland, though. :)
Finland, Finland, Finland, the country where I quite want to be.  Your mountains so lofty, your treetops so tall...
What mountains? There are no mountains....we have tunturi, but those could be translated as a hill. =D

Do you know what the Estonian hairlip said after getting stoned for stealing a goat?

"Finncon Rocks"

Thank you for visiting us! You and lovely Parris made my first Finncon a wonderful experience. Have a safe journey back home!

-Raija

Having just moved to Ottawa from Montreal, I'm now sad that I'll miss you being there! Poop.

If you want recommendations for nice places for food/drinks/coffee, hit me up. I lived there for ten years and know them ALL.

Though Ottawa has some good stuff too :)
Having just moved to Montreal from Ottawa, I'm pretty stoked. :-P

Montreal awaits you sire!

With arms open and accents aplenty :¬) You will have a taste of our continental-europeanish welcomness...

In short, I’m hoping to meet you in a few weeks time...
Turku is the best thing ever!  Oh...wait...you mean the city and not the band.
It was wonderful to meet you too! Thank you for coming!

I just read that you will be in Montreal. How exciting! However, the link to the convention does not mention your name (probably the guest list is not finalized). I would like to know if you will be there for the whole convention and precisely what day or time we can meet you. Thanks - a long-time fan!
comments.subject: Montreal?!?

comments.article: Wow. I've been trying to decide if I should go to Montreal where there is a Harley I want to buy. With this George appearance coming to light it adds a whole new factor to concider. I gotta go! A Harley and a chance to meet GRRM! Sounds like a trip to me!
comments.subject: Re: Montreal?!?

comments.article:
I don't know how you guys do all the long flights and cracks of dawn and interviews and signings and photos! Im wreched after one day of bus journeys and a few hours drama and dance with kids. Once or twice a week is about as much as I can do at the mo!

Hope you enjoy your last night together before we steal Phipps away again.

Big Love an a Bear Hug to you george, and Phipps: see you soon!
xox
comments.subject: Well done!

comments.article: Green Chile? Is it hot, spicy or mild? Is there a recipe?
Words (even George's I bet) can't adequately describe green chili, made correctly.  Yum.  You need to visit northern New Mexico.
If you had a Facebook fan page, you could post a bunch of pics of your trip for us to ogle over.  I'm just saying... ;-)

Just noticed your cap :D You need a new picture! With the new cap!

Thank you again for being such a nice GoH and give my love to Parris as well :)

comments.upictitle: al_zorra: white kitsune under white moon
comments.article:
I'm envious that you were in Estonia. I want to visit that region so much: Estonia, Lativa, Lithuania and Poland.

Love, C.

Have a safe trip!

Green chile - I miss that living here in WA. Though, a new restaurant opened a few months ago in my little town and they get their chile straight from Hatch.
As a writer! be fertile as ever, my lord.
comments.subject: It's good to see how you are having grea times

comments.article: I hope you enjoy your travels!
Thanks for everything!

Glad to know you enjoyed your stay in Finland/Estonia. Envy you... Have a safe journey home! Happy to hear you'll return to Dance with Dragons though :-) Take your time and do it WELL. It's always good to have something to look forward to.

I feel cheesey even writing this comment, since I rarely comment or ask questions on blogs at all. But, I have to know since I'm going to Santa Fe with a friend inthree weeks: Where is the best place, frequented by locals, for green chili and other yummy Mexican food in Santa Fe? Hope this isn't too obnoxiously opportunistic, but you're the only Santa Fe resident I can ask! LOL
Glad your adventures continue to be good ones, and your travels safe!Amanda
comments.subject: Green Chili

comments.article: Im guessing... do you find inspiration in your trips? :P Maybe the Finland dawn will be whatevers place down in your books?:P
